TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GenericXmlSecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based upon XML.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the GenericXmlSecurityToken class when you receive a token over the wire that is not defined in a specification or there is no way for you to determine the type of the security token. For example, in a federation scenario when you send a Request Security Token (RST) to a Security Token Service (STS) you do not always know the type of the security token returned by the STS. In such cases, you can use a GenericXmlSecurityToken to store the security token as XML along with its internal and external references.
Use the GenericXmlSecurityToken class to define claims using XML when one of the built-in security tokens does not suffice. Other security tokens can define their claims using XML, however the GenericXmlSecurityToken security token generically allows a security token to have an application-defined set of XML.

MemberSignature.Value: public GenericXmlSecurityToken (System.Xml.XmlElement tokenXml, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken proofToken, DateTime effectiveTime, DateTime expirationTime, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause internalTokenReference, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause externalTokenReference, System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy> authorizationPolicies);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Xml.XmlElement tokenXml, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken proofToken, valuetype System.DateTime effectiveTime, valuetype System.DateTime expirationTime, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause internalTokenReference, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause externalTokenReference, class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<class System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy> authorizationPolicies) cil managed

Docs.param: An that represents the XML that is associated with the security token. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.TokenXml%2A> property.
A that represents the proof token for the security token. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ProofToken%2A> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property.

A that represents a reference to this security token when it is included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> property.

A that represents a reference to this security token when it is not included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property.
A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the `internalTokenReference` parameter is `null`, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause> key identifier clause is created for this security token and set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> property.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> is obtained in a federation scenario, the proof token contains the key that is encrypted for the client.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of authorization policies for this security token.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.

Docs.summary: Gets a security key identifier clause that references this security token when this security token is not included in the SOAP message in which it is referenced.
Docs.value: A that represents a reference to this security token when it is not included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.

Docs.summary: Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
Docs.value: The unique identifier of the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token is serialized into XML, the value of the `Id` attribute is set to the value of the Id property.

Docs.summary: Gets a security key identifier clause that references this security token when this security token is included in the SOAP message in which it is referenced.
Docs.value: A that represents a reference to this security token when it is included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause keyIdentifierClause) cil managed

Docs.param: An to compare to this instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance is equal to the specified key identifier.
Docs.returns: when is not and matches either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> property values; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `keyIdentifierClause` parameter is matched against the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> property values using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.Matches%2A> method on the key identifier clause that is returned by the property values.

Docs.summary: Gets the proof token for the security token.
Docs.value: A that represents the proof token for the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The proof token is the security token that the requester of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token used for authentication in obtaining the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token.

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the proof token.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type that contains the set of keys associated with the proof token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The proof token can be obtained by getting the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ProofToken%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the XML that is associated with the security token.
Docs.value: An that represents the XML that is associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token is extensible, so exactly what is contained within the XML is application-dependent.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ToString method returns the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> properties.

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ValidFrom and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> token is valid. The ValidFrom and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
The ValidFrom property is specified using the `effectiveTime` parameter of the constructor. The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and ValidTo properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> token is valid. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and ValidTo properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
The ValidTo property is specified using the `expirationTime` parameter of the constructor. The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
